title: British & Irish Literature part B - After 1950
description:
English (British) and Irish literature part B: from 1950 to our days
====================================================================

About the collection

This is my collection of English (British) and Irish literature (so no American authors and no foreign, translated authors)
It is divided into three sections: 
A: Past (from Medieval till the first decades of the 20th century)Basically the classics. It's here: https://thepiratebay.se/torrent/13266393 
B (this one):Present (from 1950 onwards) and a separate section for 
C: Science Fiction, Fantasy and the like (you'll find Wells, Tolkien, Diana Wynne Jones, Neil Gaiman and J.K.Rowling there). 

The books are mainly in .epub and .pdf, because I don't own a Kindle and I dislike the very idea of a proprietary format and ereader which binds you as its slave, in exchange for the low price. I usually go for ereaders which support the greatest number of formats. 

My naming convention is different than found in collections that come from Calibre. I hate it when the books are by book title and not by author, because I want the books by the same author to be shown together even when they are not grouped in a folder.

Sources
=======

These are not my own scans or OCR. They have been collected over many years from the web, either from huge messy book torrents containing a bit of everything or one by one from free download sites such as gutenberg, archive org and such; a bunch of them came with my various e-readers. 
My only merit, then, is collecting and organizing them, but I assure you that it was quite a bit of work. I picked those which belong to this category from the chaos of most book torrents, or downloaded the free books one by one. Then I renamed them consistently to prune out doubles and make search easy. Iâ€™ve taken out meaningless folder numbers , deleted .opf and other useless files. In many cases Iâ€™ve added a .txt file with info about authors, added authorâ€™s year of birth and death, or found a book cover when there wasnâ€™t any. 

You might find some books twice: usually because one is a scan of a regular book and the other one with the blown-up font used for e-readers, or sometimes one will include a cover and the other wonâ€™t. .. things like that. The collection is not compressed, so if these things donâ€™t matter to you, feel free to skip downloading one of the two. 


You might also enjoy:
Writing manuals collection - 42 books on the art of writing https://thepiratebay.se/torrent/13266319
